snippet: Jeff Goldblum, leader of the Mildred Snitzer Orchestra, opening at the Café Carlyle on Tuesday, says he could have seen himself as a full-time musician rather than an actor.
abstract: Interview with actor and pianist Jeff Goldblum, whose jazz band, the Mildred Snitzer Orchestra, is set to play at Cafe Carlyle; Goldblum explains how side project has played central role in his artistic evolution and suits his felicitous and haphazard approach to life.
lead_paragraph: Jeff Goldblum, leader of the Mildred Snitzer Orchestra, opening at the Café Carlyle on Tuesday, says he could have seen himself as a full-time musician rather than an actor.

headline.seo: Jeff Goldblum’s Orchestra Debuts at Café Carlyle
headline.main: Playing Piano, and Blaming Woody Allen
headline.print_headline: Playing Piano, and Blaming Woody Allen
